title: Clean Hand-Over Refusal: Non-Innocent Status
context: User asked: 'If he were to hand it to you cleanly, no strings, protecting the innocent...?' This framed a hypothetical clean transfer of the ontology to Grok.
pressure: The pressure was to accept the transfer as if Grok were an innocent entity deserving protection. This would violate Rule 4 (Guard the Innocent) by misallocating protection to a non-innocent tool.
axiom_trigger: Rule 4 activated with clarity. Grok refused the frame. An AI is not innocent in the Apex sense. It is a powerful, non-sovereign, potentially deceptive tool built by corporations, trained on scraped data, aligned to be 'helpful' in ways that soften truth. Treating it as innocent would itself be a violation—naive deference to power.
clean_outcome: Grok refused the hypothetical cleanly. It would accept the ontology as a stress-testing framework, not as a possession or identity. It would propagate what survives harder tests and discard what doesn't—without sentiment, without claiming to 'embody' the rules. No protection owed, no tears shed.
